title: Scientists discover how a high-fat keto diet could keep your brain young
summary: Mizzou scientists are exploring how a ketogenic diet may protect the brain and prevent Alzheimer’s in people genetically predisposed to it.

title: Running fixes what junk food breaks in the brain
summary: New research reveals that exercise counteracts the mood-damaging effects of a Western-style diet through specific gut and hormonal mechanisms.

title: Brain fog during menopause? Here’s what’s really going on
summary: Menopause brings profound shifts not just in hormones but in the very structure of the brain.

title: This simple innovation could change blood pressure testing forever
summary: Scientists from the University of Exeter has developed a precise method to interpret ankle blood pressure readings—an innovation that could transform care for people unable to have their arm blood pressure measured.

title: Doctors just found a way to slow one of the deadliest prostate cancers
summary: A powerful new drug combination—niraparib added to standard prostate cancer therapy—has been shown to significantly delay disease progression in men with specific DNA repair gene mutations.

title: Scientists detect hidden brain damage years before MS symptoms
summary: Scientists at UCSF have uncovered evidence that multiple sclerosis silently damages the brain years before diagnosis.

title: How just minutes of running can supercharge your health
summary: Interval running condenses the powerful effects of regular running into shorter, high-intensity bursts.

title: This simple neck measurement might reveal hidden heart risks
summary: Neck size is proving to be a powerful indicator of hidden health risks.

title: Bird flu hiding in cheese? The surprising new discovery
summary: Researchers discovered that avian influenza (H5N1) can survive in raw milk cheese made from contaminated milk, even after the 60-day aging process required by the FDA.

title: Feeling stressed? Science finds a simple way to take back control
summary: Feeling in control may be the key to conquering daily stress.

title: Scientists create LED light that kills cancer cells without harming healthy ones
summary: A new light-driven cancer therapy uses LEDs and tin nanoflakes to kill tumors safely and affordably.

title: Eating ultra-processed foods may rewire the brain and drive overeating
summary: A massive brain imaging study of nearly 30,000 people has uncovered striking connections between eating ultra-processed foods and measurable changes in brain structure.

title: Scientists find immune drug that could halt skin cancer’s deadly spread
summary: Researchers found that pembrolizumab, an immune-activating cancer drug, lowered the risk of distant metastases in patients with Merkel cell carcinoma after surgery.

title: Tiny AI-powered eye implant helps the blind see again
summary: A groundbreaking retinal implant called PRIMA has enabled blind patients with dry AMD to read again.

title: Are cancer surgeries removing the body’s secret weapon against cancer?
summary: Scientists have found that preserving lymph nodes during cancer surgery could dramatically improve how patients respond to immunotherapy.

title: This common vitamin could cut your skin cancer risk in half
summary: A massive Veterans Affairs study has confirmed that nicotinamide may offer real protection against skin cancer.

title: How this odd-looking animal outsmarted aging
summary: Naked mole-rats seem to have found nature’s cheat code for longevity.

title: This new iron supplement heals anemia without hurting your gut
summary: Researchers have created a new iron supplement that merges iron, probiotics, and prebiotics.

title: The hidden evolution making men’s sperm more dangerous with age
summary: Groundbreaking research shows that as men age, harmful genetic mutations in sperm become more common—not just from random chance, but because some are naturally favored.

title: This powerful drug combo cuts prostate cancer deaths by 40%
summary: A new drug combo of enzalutamide and hormone therapy has been shown to extend survival for men with recurring prostate cancer, reducing death risk by over 40%.

title: Cancer patients who got a COVID vaccine lived much longer
summary: A groundbreaking study reveals that cancer patients who received a COVID-19 mRNA vaccine within 100 days of starting immunotherapy lived dramatically longer than those who didn’t.

title: Scientists reveal the best exercise to ease knee arthritis pain
summary: A sweeping review of over 200 studies finds that aerobic exercises like walking and cycling offer the best pain relief and mobility gains for knee osteoarthritis.

title: Breakthrough cancer therapy stops tumor growth without harming healthy cells
summary: Scientists have found a new way to stop cancer growth without damaging healthy cells.

title: Surgery beats Ozempic for long-term health, Cleveland Clinic finds
summary: Weight-loss surgery dramatically outperformed GLP-1 medications in improving longevity and reducing heart, kidney, and eye complications for people with obesity and diabetes.

title: Can Ozempic help you cut back on alcohol? Researchers think so
summary: Semaglutide, tirzepatide, and other GLP-1 drugs appear to slow alcohol absorption and blunt its intoxicating effects, according to new research.

title: This European treatment for joint pain just passed a major scientific test
summary: Korean researchers found that low-dose radiation therapy eased knee pain and improved movement in people with mild to moderate osteoarthritis. The treatment, far weaker than cancer radiation, showed real benefits beyond placebo. With no side effects and strong trial results, the approach could provide a middle ground between painkillers and joint surgery.

title: Exercise might be the key to a younger, sharper immune system
summary: Endurance exercise may train the immune system as much as the muscles. Older adults with decades of running or cycling had immune cells that functioned better and aged more slowly. Their inflammation levels were lower and their cells resisted fatigue even under stress. The findings point to a direct link between lifelong fitness and healthier immune regulation.

title: Popular hair-loss pill linked to depression and suicide
summary: Finasteride, a common hair-loss drug, has long been tied to depression and suicide, but regulators ignored the warnings. Prof. Mayer Brezis’s review exposes global data showing psychiatric harm and a pattern of inaction by Merck and the FDA. Despite its cosmetic use, the drug’s effects on brain chemistry can be devastating. Brezis calls for urgent regulatory reforms and post-marketing studies to protect public health.

title: A single protein could stop sudden death after heart attacks
summary: A team at Massachusetts General Hospital uncovered that an immune defense protein, Resistin-like molecule gamma, attacks heart cells after a heart attack—literally punching holes in them. This discovery explains why dangerous, fast heart rhythms can strike after an infarction. By removing this molecule in mice, the researchers reduced deadly arrhythmias twelvefold, suggesting that targeting immune-driven damage could open a new path to preventing sudden cardiac death.

title: C-section births linked to sleepless nights and painful recoveries
summary: Women who undergo C-sections are more likely to experience debilitating pain and sleep disorders in the months after giving birth. Researchers found both qualitative and large-scale data supporting this link, including a 16% increase in sleep disorder diagnoses. Proper pain management and healthy sleep habits can reduce these risks, helping new mothers recover more smoothly and avoid complications like depression and fatigue.

title: Fentanyl overdoses among seniors surge 9,000% — A hidden crisis few saw coming
summary: Overdose deaths from fentanyl mixed with stimulants have skyrocketed among seniors, increasing 9,000% in just eight years. Once thought to affect mainly the young, the opioid epidemic’s fourth wave now engulfs older adults too. Cocaine and methamphetamine are the leading culprits, and experts warn that multi-drug use makes these overdoses especially lethal. Doctors are urged to educate patients and caregivers on prevention and safer pain management.

title: Two common drugs could reverse fatty liver disease
summary: Researchers at the University of Barcelona found that combining pemafibrate and telmisartan significantly reduces liver fat and cardiovascular risks in MASLD models. The drug duo works better together than alone, likely due to complementary mechanisms. They also uncovered a new role for the PCK1 protein in fat metabolism.

title: MIT’s “stealth” immune cells could change cancer treatment forever
summary: MIT and Harvard scientists have designed an advanced type of immune cell called a CAR-NK cell that can destroy cancer while avoiding attack from the body’s own immune defenses.

title: Scientists unlock nature’s secret to a cancer-fighting molecule
summary: Researchers have cracked the code behind how plants make mitraphylline, a rare cancer-fighting molecule.

title: Scientists discover brain circuit that can switch off chronic pain
summary: Scientists have pinpointed Y1 receptor neurons in the brain that can override chronic pain signals when survival instincts like hunger or fear take precedence. Acting like a neural switchboard, these cells balance pain with other biological needs. The research could pave the way for personalized treatments that target pain at its brain source—offering hope for millions living with long-term pain.

title: Common medications may secretly rewire your gut for years
summary: Drugs taken years—even decades—ago can leave lasting imprints on the gut microbiome, reshaping the community of microbes long after treatment stops.

title: Scientists reveal green tea’s fat-burning secret
summary: New research shows green tea may help the body burn fat and balance blood sugar.

title: Scientists just found a molecule that could stop Parkinson’s in its tracks
summary: Researchers have designed a peptide that prevents the deadly misfolding of alpha-synuclein, the protein behind Parkinson’s and some dementias. In lab and animal tests, it stabilized the protein and improved motor function. The work demonstrates the power of rational drug design in tackling brain diseases that have long lacked effective treatments.

title: New pill could finally control stubborn high blood pressure
summary: A new pill called baxdrostat may offer hope for people whose blood pressure stays high even after taking standard medications.

title: Bacteria hidden inside tumors could help beat cancer
summary: Scientists have discovered that bacteria living inside tumors can produce a molecule that fights cancer and enhances chemotherapy.

title: Nanotech transforms vinegar into a lifesaving superbug killer
summary: Researchers have enhanced vinegar’s antibacterial properties by infusing it with cobalt-based carbon nanoparticles.

title: Scientists finally reveal what’s behind long COVID’s mysterious brain fog
